abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Energy Sector Loan Project
            will contribute to macroeconomic adjustment aimed at
            achieving energy targets by continuing the process of
            sectoral adjustment outlined in the Long Term Strategy for
            the Development of Energy (LES). This adjustment program,
            comprised of policies and institutional reforms, will be
            introduced during the Seventh Plan. It will support the
            implementation of the Core Investment Program (CIP)
            (FY89-91) which will comprise new investments to be launched
            during the Seventh Plan and, in some cases, completion of
            those which were launched during the Sixth Plan. It will
            also mobilize resources for CIP by rationalizing energy
            pricing, integrating donor cofinancing, mobilizing private
            sector financing, and coordinating access to the credit and
            capital markets. Finally, it will support the macroeconomic
            adjustment program by facilitating an adequate level of
            imports.  As a supplement to the ongoing investment program,
            the loan will provide additional assistance for two priority
            energy sector projects in the Core Investment Program,
            involving the Sui Southern Gas Company (SSGC) and the Water
            and Power Development Authority (WAPDA). Their
            implementation is necessitated by the adverse impact on
            Pakistan's balance of payments resulting from the Gulf
            crisis.  The SSGC component for installation of a gas
            purification plant will help SSGC's gas delivery
            capacity and will reduce the imports of petroleum products.
            The WAPDA component, which is to modify the Kot Addu Power
            Plant to permit the use of natural gas in lieu of diesel
            oil, will have a beneficial environmental impact.  The
            Supplemental Loan will:  (a) cover the foreign exchange
            costs of goods and services for the installation of a gas
            purification plant for SSGC; and (b) part of the foreign
            exchange costs of gas conversion equipment to be installed
            at WAPDA's Kot Addu Plant, to allow substitution of
            domestically supplied natural gas for high speed diesel fuel.
